intro: [WRONG START] Carex omiana var. omiona, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to moist, shaded environments in temperate regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flower spikes that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and prefers well-drained, fertile soils. Carex omiana var. omiana is often used in ornamental landscaping for its fine texture and ability to thrive in wet conditions.
